<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/chardham-yatra-nri-special-tour-package.jpg" alt="Char Dham Yatra for NRI Tour Package" title="Char Dham Yatra for NRI Tour Package" width="750" height="450" class="smush-detected-img smush-image-3" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>With our Char Dham yatra for NRI tour package, you can seek divine blessings and fulfill your spiritual desires. Whether you live in Canada, the USA, Dubai, Singapore, Malaysia, Australia or any other part of the world we can arrange the Char Dham tour allowing you to experience the presence of God at its closest. With this package, you’ll get a chance to visit four of the most sacred destinations- Kedarnath, Badrinath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri. You can participate in various rituals held at these sacred sites and offer prayers to the deities. We have designed this package thoughtfully to cater to the diverse needs of NRIs looking to have a sacred connection with their roots. We offer a customized travel package that includes sightseeing, accommodation, sightseeing, meals, transportation and other amenities. </p>
<p>Experience a harmonious blend of devotion, culture, and tradition as you visit the revered Char Dham sites by booking our package. Our Char Dham NRI tour packages come with guided tours that are led by experts who try their best to enhance your experience. They share cultural insights and historical context that enrich your pilgrimage. Whether you want to explore your ancestral roots or are returning to your homeland, our packages provide a once-in-a-lifetime chance to deepen your connection with the rich heritage of India.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Tour Itinerary</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Arrival in Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>Your Char Dham tour will start from Delhi, the heart of India. As you arrive at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi our representative will greet you and welcome you with open arms. After picking you up from the airport our representative will transfer you to your pre-reserved hotel where you will have an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Delhi - Haridwar - Drive: Time: 06 – 07 hrs.- 220 km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Wake up early in the morning and relish a tasty breakfast. Post breakfast, you will check out from your hotel and embark on a pleasant drive to Haridwar. You’ll reach Haridwar by the evening and check in to your pre-booked hotel. After relaxing for some time you will head to Har Ki Pauri, a sacred ghat in Haridwar. You’ll attend the Ganga Aarti at the ghat. After that, you’ll return to your hotel and have a soothing sleep in your room.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Haridwar – Barkot - Time: 06 – 07 hrs.- Drive: 177 km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Savour a delicious breakfast in the morning at your hotel and then you’ll embark on a picturesque drive to Barkot. On the way you will stop by Kempty Fall, a cascading waterfall surrounded by mountains and lush green forests. Continue your journey to Barkot and then check in to your camp and have a mouth-watering dinner. Post dinner you will have an overnight stay at your camp.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Barkot – Yamunotri – Barkot - Trek: 05 km- Drive: 45 km + 45 km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Today you will wake up early in the morning and relish a tasty breakfast. After breakfast, you will embark on a scenic drive to Jankichatti, ie the starting point of the trek to Yamunotri Dham. You can trek or take a pony/doli to reach Yamunotri Dham. Once you have arrived at Yamunotri Dham, you will buy Prasadam from local shops. Once you have reached the temple premises you will take a holy dip in the holy water. After the bath, you will head to the main temple to seek blessings from Mata Yamuna. Later you’ll trek down towards Jankichatti. From Jankichatti you’ll drive back to Barkot for dinner. Post dinner you will have an overnight stay at your hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Barkot – Uttarkashi - Drive: Time: 03 – 04 hrs.- 81 km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Have a tasty breakfast in the morning and then embark on a scenic drive to Uttarkashi. After arriving at Uttarkashi you will visit Hanuman Temple and Vishwanath Temple. Hanuman Temple is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and it is believed carrying the mountain Sanjivani to Lanka Lord Hanuman rested at this spot. Vishwanath Temple was constructed by Queen Khaneti Devi over an ancient altar that dates back to the era of Mahabharata. Later you’ll drive around 5 km. to reach your pre-booked resort. You will check in to your luxurious resort for dinner. Post dinner you will have an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Uttarkashi – Gangotri – Uttarkashi - Drive: Time: 06 hrs-92 km one side</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Wake up early in the morning and head to Gangotri Dham. During the sacred yatra, you will take a halt at Gangnani and take a dip in the hot water spring. You will then continue your drive to Gangotri via Harsil. Once you have arrived at Gangotri Dham you’ll perform pooja at the river Bhagirathi’s bank and seek Goddess Ganga’s blessings. After pooja, you will head to the main temple and have Mata Ganga’s darshan. Post darshan you will head back to Uttarkashi.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Uttarkashi - Guptkashi Time: 07 – 08 hrs.- Drive: 198 km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Have breakfast early in the morning. After breakfast, you’ll embark on a scenic drive to Gupatkashi. On the way, you’ll pass by Tehri Dam which is known to be the highest dam in India. Once you have reached Guptkashi, you will check in to your pre-reserved resort for dinner. Post dinner you will have an overnight stay at your hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Guptkashi – Kedarnath - Trek: 19 kms- Drive: 45 kms.</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Wake up early in the morning and then embark on a drive to Sonprayag. Once you have arrived at Sonprayag you will take a local jeep that will drop you at Gaurikund (2 km). From Gaurikund you will begin your trek to Kedarnath. After arriving at Kedarnath you’ll check in to the guest house. Relax for some time and then you’ll get ready to visit Kedarnath Temple to attend the evening Aarti. Post aarti you will return to your guest house and have an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Kedarnath – Rudraparyag - Trek: 18 kms- Drive: 75 kms</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Today you’ll wake up early in the morning and get ready to visit Kedarnath temple to attend the morning Aarti. After the Aarti and darshan of Lord Kedar, you’ll head back to your guest house and have a yummy breakfast. Post breakfast you will pack your bags and embark on an 18 km long trek back to Gaurikund. Drive to Rudraprayag from the roadhead. After arriving at Rudraprayag you will check in to your hotel and have a mouth-watering dinner. Post dinner you will have an overnight stay at your hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 10 :</span>Rudraprayag – Badrinath Time: 06 – 07 hrs.- Drive:157 kms</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Have a lip-smacking breakfast in the morning and then embark on a picturesque drive to Badrinath which is situated on the Alaknanda River banks. After arriving at Badrinath you will check in to your hotel. Relax and unwind for some time and then in the evening you’ll head to Badrinath temple. After the darshan of Lord Badri, you will head back to your hotel and have a mouth-watering dinner. Post dinner you will have an overnight stay at your hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 11 :</span>Badrinath – Rishikesh - Drive: 295 kms.- Time: 10 – 11 hrs.</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Have a yummy breakfast in the morning and then drive to Rishikesh via Devprayag. You will stop by Devprayag to see the confluence of the Bhagirathi and Alaknanda Rivers from which the river Ganga formed. You will then continue your journey to Rishikesh admiring the scenic views. Once you have arrived at Rishikesh you will check in to your pre-booked hotel and have a tasty dinner. Post dinner you will have an overnight stay at your hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 12 :</span>Rishikesh - Delhi Drive 6 Hrs/232 Kms</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Post breakfast you will complete the check-out formalities and drive back to Delhi. Once you have reached Delhi you’ll check in to your pre-booked hotel and have an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 13 :</span>Departure from Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display:none">
<p>Relish a yummy breakfast in the morning and then pack your bags and check out from your pre-reserved hotel. You’ll be transferred to the airport or railway station from where you’ll head to your hometown.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB7">
<div class="tour-collection">
<div class="pkg-inc">
<p>Package Inclusion</p>
<ul>
<li>You will be under the assistance of a well-knowledge representative or guide throughout the trip.</li>
<li>We provide our customers with top-notch accommodation which is pretty clean, hygienic, and the rooms are available on a double sharing basis.</li>
<li>Smooth and easy pick-up and drop facility by an air-conditioned vehicle is offered to our guests. Although the charges are not fixed and it varies according to the road condition and the number of members present in the group.</li>
<li>The air-conditioned transport facilities are operationally available from Delhi to Rishikesh and vice-versa.</li>
<li>As this is a religious tour so you will only be served with vegetarian meals. Scrumptious morning meal, lunch, and dinner along with morning and evening tea or coffee (as per your choice) are the meals and beverages included in our package.</li>
<li>Our tour manager will be accompanying you throughout the trip and will take care of your safety on the trip.</li>
<li>Rishikesh is one of the most important destinations of the trip that needs special attention so you will be accompanied by a well-experienced tour guide for Rishikesh.</li>
<li>You will be offered with 1 litter of mineral water every day for drinking purpose.</li>
<li>Pick up and drop facilities at the airport are also included in this package.</li>
<li>If you cover the sightseeing destinations which are not mentioned in the itinerary then you need to pay an additional amount for that.</li>
<li>Taxes like parking toll tax, state tax, driver allowance, and fuel charges are also mentioned in the cost inclusion column of our itinerary. Besides all these expenses additional hotel tax and transportation tax are also applicable.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="pkg-exc">
<p>Package Exclusions</p>
<ul>
<li>Personal expenses like porter charge, telephone bills, camera fees, tipping, and laundry, etc. are not included in the itinerary and so these charges will be borne by you.</li>
<li>If you are looking for any sort of insurance then, unfortunately, there is no provision or mentioning of the insurance claim in the itinerary.</li>
<li>If in case your trip is getting delayed due to any unfavourable situation or natural calamities like landslides resulting in road blockage. I hope you understand that this is not in our hands so we are not liable to pay this charge and this is why it is not mentioned in our cost inclusion column. Also, we will not be able to cover all the destinations that are mentioned in our itinerary and we don’t find ourselves liable for this refund.</li>
<li>Kedarnath being nestled at a huge elevation is difficult to access by everyone so for Kedarnath pilgrims we provide accommodations at Sitapur and even it is pretty difficult for our catering team to reach there and this makes serving foods to our guests difficult at Kedarnath.</li>
<li>If in any situation you feel that you require helicopter services then you need to pay an additional amount for this. Also, if you are looking auto for transfer from Haridwar to Rishikesh then this will also be borne by you.</li>
<li>Ropeway rides, pony and palanquin rides are also offered to you on extra charge.</li>
<li>Be ready to pay an additional 5% charge on the total amount as GST.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Char Dham Yatra for NRI Tour Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span>What documents are required for the Char Dham yatra NRI tour?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow:hidden;display:none">
<div itemprop="text">
<p>For the Char Dham yatra NRI tour, you will need to have a valid passport having at least six months of validity from your travel date to India. Based on your nationality visa requirements can vary. You’ll also need photocopies of important documents such as IDs, passports and visas.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span>Which countries NRIs can embark on the Char Dham yatra?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow:hidden;display:none">
<div itemprop="text">
<p>NRIs residing in countries such as Canada, the USA, Malaysia, Singapore, UAE, Australia, and the United States can embark on the Char Dham yatra from India.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span>What is the best time for the Char Dham yatra NRI tour?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow:hidden;display:none">
<div itemprop="text">
<p>September to October and April to June are the best time for the Char Dham Yatra NRI tour. During these months, the weather remains comfortable, making it hassle-free to navigate through the high-altitude region. During the monsoon( July to August) you should avoid visiting Char Dham sites as roadblocks and landslides are quite common.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span>What special requirements should NRIs keep in mind during Char Dham yatra?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow:hidden;display:none">
<div itemprop="text">
<p>NRIs should always travel in groups and obtain all the necessary permits required for the Char Dham yatra. Hire knowledgeable guides who can enhance your travel experience by sharing important details about the significance and history of each sacred site.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span>What are the things NRIs should avoid during during Char Dham yatra?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow:hidden;display:none">
<div itemprop="text">
<p>During Char Dham yatra NRIs should carry an optimum amount of cash as many places may not accept digital payment. Avoid overpacking and carry comfortable shoes during the yatra. Check about the weather conditions before the yatra and avoid traveling alone.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
